EmailTemplate.name: Certification
EmailTemplate.Body:
A new access certification report has been assigned to you: $workItemName.
Login and view your work item inbox to complete this access certification report.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying work item owners of new certifications.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The description property (also the name property) of the certification WorkItem.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem object for the certification.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object.

Argument.name: requesterName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that requested the certification.

Argument.name: ownerName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that owns the certification.

EmailTemplate.Subject: New access certification: $workItemName

EmailTemplate.name: Bulk Reassignment
EmailTemplate.Body:
$!requesterName has assigned $numNewIdentities users to you for access certification. These have been added to $certificationName.
Description: $!description
Comments from $!requesterName: -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $!comments --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Login and view your work item inbox to complete this access certification report.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying a user when they have been reassigned identities from an existing certification.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the Certification containing the items to reassign.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object containing the items to reassign.

Argument.name: owner
Argument.Description: The Identity object receiving the reassignment request.

Argument.name: comments
Argument.Description: Comments from the reassigner.

Argument.name: description
Argument.Description: Description of the reassignment.

Argument.name: numNewIdentities
Argument.Description: Number of identities reassigned, passed as a string.

Argument.name: requesterName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that requested the reassignment.

EmailTemplate.Subject: New certification reassignment request: $certificationName

EmailTemplate.name: Delegation
EmailTemplate.Body:
$!requesterName has delegated the following work item to you: $!workItemName.
Comments from $!requesterName: -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $!comments --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Login and view your work item inbox to complete this request.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying work item owners of new delegations.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem created for this delegation.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The description property (also the name property) of the delegation WorkItem.

Argument.name: comments
Argument.Description: Comments from the delegator.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object containing the delegated item.

Argument.name: requesterName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that requested the delegation.

EmailTemplate.Subject: New delegation request: $!workItemName

EmailTemplate.name: Delegation Revocation
EmailTemplate.Body: $requesterName has revoked the following work item from you: $workItemName. This work item will no longer appear in your queue.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying work item owners that their delegation work item has been revoked.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The description property of the delegation WorkItem.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object containing the delegated item.

Argument.name: requesterName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that requested the delegation.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Work item revoked: $workItemName

EmailTemplate.name: Delegation Finished
EmailTemplate.Body: $delegateeName has finished the delegated item '$workItemName'. Please review the items.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying the original owner that the delegated item has been completed.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The description property of the delegation WorkItem.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object containing the delegated item.

Argument.name: delegateeName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that finished the delegation.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Delegation Completed by $delegateeName

EmailTemplate.name: Remediation Notification
EmailTemplate.Body:
$requesterName has revoked one or more entitlements from you.
Comments from $requesterName: -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $!comments --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
#if ($remediationDetails.nonModifyAccountRequests && $remediationDetails.getNonModifyAccountRequests().size() > 0)
Account Requests: ----------------- #foreach ($acctReq in $remediationDetails.nonModifyAccountRequests) Application: $acctReq.applicationName Operation: $acctReq.operation Account ID: $acctReq.nativeIdentity
#end #end #if ($remediationDetails.modifyAccountRequests && $remediationDetails.getModifyAccountRequests().size() > 0)
Modification Requests: ---------------------- #foreach ($acctReq in $remediationDetails.modifyAccountRequests) Application: $acctReq.applicationName #if ($acctReq.nativeIdentity) ## Role modification requests in IIQ won't have a nativeIdentity Account ID: $acctReq.nativeIdentity #end
#foreach ($attrReq in $acctReq.attributeRequests) Operation: $attrReq.operation Attribute: $attrReq.name Value(s): $attrReq.value
#end #foreach ($permReq in $acctReq.permissionRequests) Operation: $permReq.operation Permission: $permReq.target Right(s): $permReq.rightsList
#end
#end #end
EmailTemplate.Description:
Email Template for notifying users that an item has been remediated. Notice that this is setup to CC the user's manager (see CC attribute above).
Arguments --------- item: The CertificationItem being remediated. remediationDetails: The ProvisioningPlan with the entitlements being removed. (Convenience accessor for item.action.remediationDetails) identity: The Identity that is having their item remediated. comments: Comments from the remediator about the remediation. requester: The Identity that remediated the item. requesterName: Full name of the Identity that remediated the item. (Convenience accessor for requestor.fullName)

Argument.name: item
Argument.Description: The CertificationItem being remediated.

Argument.name: remediationDetails
Argument.Description: The ProvisioningPlan with the entitlements being removed (Convenience accessor for item.action.remediationDetails).

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The Identity that owns the item being remediated.

Argument.name: comments
Argument.Description: Comments from the remediator about the reason for remediation.

Argument.name: requesterName
Argument.Description: The display name (usually full name) of the identity that requested the remediation.

Argument.name: requester
Argument.Description: The Identity object of the requester.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Access is being revoked by $requesterName

EmailTemplate.name: Remediation Work Item
EmailTemplate.Body:
$!requesterName has assigned a new remediation work item to you: $!workItemName.
Comments from $!requesterName: -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $!comments --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Login and view your work item inbox to complete this request.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying work item owners of new remediation requests.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The name (also the description) of the remediation work item.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem object representing the remediation.

Argument.name: requesterName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that requested the remediation.

Argument.name: comments
Argument.Description: The Identity object that is the owner of the work item.

EmailTemplate.Subject: New remediation request: $!workItemName

EmailTemplate.name: Certification Sign Off Approval
EmailTemplate.Body:
$certification.name was signed by $certifier.displayableName and requires your approval.
Login and view your work item inbox to complete this request.
EmailTemplate.Description:
Email Template for notifying users when a certification is signed and sent to them for approval.
This supports the following parameters: - certification: The sailpoint.object.Certification object that was signed. - certifier: The sailpoint.object.Identity that signed the certification. - approver: The sailpoint.object.Identity that needs to approve the certification. This is the recipient of this email.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object containing the delegated item.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem object for the certification approval.

Argument.name: certifier
Argument.Description: The Identity object for the user that finished the certification.

Argument.name: approver
Argument.Description: The Identity object that is the owner of the work item.

EmailTemplate.Subject: $certification.name requires approval

EmailTemplate.name: Certification Reminder
EmailTemplate.Body:
$recipient.displayableName, The certification "$certification.name" is still open and needs to be completed.#if ($certification.expiration) This certification must be finished by $spTools.formatDate($certification.expiration,3,1).#{end} Please login to IdentityIQ to complete your work.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $!comment --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sincerely, $sender.displayableName
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for reminding a certification owner that they have a certification waiting for them to complete. This is an "instant" email sent on demand from the certification dashboard components. See EmailBean and Emailer.compileOpenCertEmail for context.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object we are reminding someone about.

Argument.name: recipient
Argument.Description: The Identity object of the user being reminded.

Argument.name: sender
Argument.Description: The Identity object of the user doing the reminding.

Argument.name: comment
Argument.Description: Optional comment from the sender.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Reminder: Certification needs your attention

EmailTemplate.name: Work Item Reminder
EmailTemplate.Body:
This is your $ordinalNumReminders reminder that the work item $workItemName #if($requester)requested by $requester.displayableName, and #{end}created on $spTools.formatDate($created,3,1), #if($expiration)#if($expiration.getTime() > $nowDate.getTime())is due on $spTools.formatDate($expiration,3,1).#{else}was due on $spTools.formatDate($expiration,3,1).#{end}#{else}was due on $spTools.formatDate($oldDueDate,3,1).#{end}
#if ($newDueDate > $expiration) The due date has been extended to $spTools.formatDate($newDueDate,3,1).
#end #if ($remindersRemaining > 0) This work item will escalate after $remindersRemaining more reminder(s).
#end Please login to IdentityIQ and view your work item inbox to resolve this at your earliest convenience.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for reminding work item owners that their work items are overdue. NOTE: In addition to the declared arguments, all entries from the work item attributes map are also available by name in the template.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem object.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The name of the WorkItem.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the Certification.

Argument.name: ownerName
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that owns the work item.

Argument.name: requester
Argument.Description: The identity object that represents the creator of the work item.

Argument.name: ordinalNumReminders
Argument.Description: The number of this reminder, starting from 1. Passed as a String.

Argument.name: remindersRemaining
Argument.Description: The number of reminders remaining after this one. Passed as a String.

Argument.name: oldDueDate
Argument.Description: The former due date, passed as a java.util.Date.

Argument.name: newDueDate
Argument.Description: The new due date, passed as a java.util.Date.

Argument.name: nowDate
Argument.Description: The current date, passed as a java.util.Date.

Argument.name: created
Argument.Description: The date the work item was created, passed as a java.util.Date.

Argument.name: expiration
Argument.Description: The optional date the work item completely expires, passed as a java.util.Date.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Work Item Reminder

EmailTemplate.name: Work Item Escalation
EmailTemplate.Body:
The work item "$workItemName" escalated. It previously belonged to $oldOwner and was due on $spTools.formatDate($oldDueDate,3,1).
It has now been assigned to you#if ($newDueDate), and its due date has been extended to $spTools.formatDate($newDueDate,3,1)#end.
Please login to IdentityIQ and view your work item inbox to resolve this at your earliest convenience.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for alerting new work item owners when an item has escalated into their queue

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem object.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The name of the WorkItem.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the Certification.

Argument.name: ownerName
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that owns the work item.

Argument.name: requester
Argument.Description: The identity object that represents the creator of the work item.

Argument.name: ordinalNumReminders
Argument.Description: The number of this reminder, starting from 1. Passed as a String.

Argument.name: remindersRemaining
Argument.Description: The number of reminders remaining after this one. Passed as a String.

Argument.name: oldDueDate
Argument.Description: The former due date, passed as a java.util.Date.

Argument.name: newDueDate
Argument.Description: The new due date, passed as a java.util.Date.

Argument.name: nowDate
Argument.Description: The current date, passed as a java.util.Date.

Argument.name: created
Argument.Description: The date the work item was created, passed as a java.util.Date.

Argument.name: expiration
Argument.Description: The optional date the work item completely expires, passed as a java.util.Date.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Escalated Work Item

EmailTemplate.name: Work Item Comment
EmailTemplate.Body:
Comment added to work item "$workItemName" by $commentAuthor on $spTools.formatDate($commentDate,3,1)
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $!commentText
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying the requester/owner of a work item that a new comment has been added.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem object on which the comment was added.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The name (also the description) of the WorkItem.

Argument.name: comment
Argument.Description: The Comment object with information about the comment.

Argument.name: commentAuthor
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that made the comment.

Argument.name: commentDate
Argument.Description: The date the comment was made, represented as a java.util.Date object.

Argument.name: commentText
Argument.Description: The text of the comment.

EmailTemplate.Subject: New comments added to work item "$workItemName"

EmailTemplate.name: Work Item Forward
EmailTemplate.Body:
$requester forwarded work item "$workItemName" from $previousOwner to $newOwner on $spTools.formatDate($forwardDate,3,1)
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $!commentText
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying the requester/new owner of a work item that it has been forwarded.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem object being forwarded.

Argument.name: workItemName
Argument.Description: The name (also the description) of the WorkItem on which a comment was added.

Argument.name: previousOwner
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that was the previous owner of the work item.

Argument.name: newOwner
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that is the new owner of the work item.

Argument.name: requester
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that requested the forwarding.

Argument.name: forwardDate
Argument.Description: The date the forwarding was requested, represented as a java.util.Date object.

Argument.name: commentText
Argument.Description: Comments about the forwarding.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Work item "$workItemName" forwarded

EmailTemplate.name: Mitigation Expiration
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying certifiers that a mitigation they requested has expired.

Argument.name: identityName
Argument.Description: The full name (first and last) of the Identity object that has the mitigation.

Argument.name: itemDescription
Argument.Description: A short description of the item that was mitigated.

Argument.name: mitigationExpiration
Argument.Description: The sailpoint.object.MitigationExpiration that is sending this notification.

Argument.name: mitigator
Argument.Description: The full name (first and last) of the Identity that created the mitigation.

Argument.name: comments
Argument.Description: Comments from the expired mitigation.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Allowed exception has expired for $!identityName

EmailTemplate.name: Policy Violation
EmailTemplate.Body: A violation of policy '$policyName' rule '$constraintName' was detected on user '$identityName'.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying policy owners of violations.

Argument.name: identity
Argument.Description: The Identity object that has the violation.

Argument.name: policy
Argument.Description: The Policy object containing the constraint that was violated.

Argument.name: constraint
Argument.Description: A subclass of BaseConstraint representing the policy rule that was violated.

Argument.name: violation
Argument.Description: The PolicyViolation object created to represent the violation.

Argument.name: identityName
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity object that has the violation.

Argument.name: policyName
Argument.Description: The name of the Policy object.

Argument.name: constraintName
Argument.Description: The name of the constraint (aka rule) within the policy.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Policy violation by $identityName

EmailTemplate.name: Policy Violation Delegation
EmailTemplate.Body: A violation of policy '$violation.policyName' rule '$violation.constraintName' for user '$violation.identity.name' has been delegated to you for action.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying users of the delegation of a policy violation.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem object representing the delegation.

Argument.name: violation
Argument.Description: The PolicyViolation object being delegated.

Argument.name: actor
Argument.Description: The Identity object performing the delegation.

Argument.name: description
Argument.Description: A short description of the violation.

Argument.name: comments
Argument.Description: Comments from the actor about the delegation.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Policy violation on $violation.identity.name

EmailTemplate.name: Challenge Period Start
EmailTemplate.Body: The challenge period has started for '$certificationName'. You will be notified if any certification decisions are challenged by the affected user.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying certification owners that the challenge period has started.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the Certification beginning the challenge period.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Challenge period started for '$certificationName'

EmailTemplate.name: Challenge Period End
EmailTemplate.Body: The challenge period has ended for '$certificationName'. Login to IdentityIQ to complete and sign off on the certification.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying certification owners that the challenge period has ended.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the Certification beginning the challenge period.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Challenge period ended for '$certificationName'

EmailTemplate.name: Challenge Creation Notification
EmailTemplate.Body:
It has been determined that your access to '$challengeItem' will be limited or removed completely. You have $timeRemaining to challenge this decision.
Click on this link to challenge the decision: http://localhost:8080/identityiq/user/challenge.jsf?id=$challengeId
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying a challenger that they can challenge a certification decision.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object containing the item being challenged.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the certification.

Argument.name: entityName
Argument.Description: The name of the item being challenged.

Argument.name: challengeItem
Argument.Description: A short description of the item being challenged.

Argument.name: timeRemaining
Argument.Description: The time remaining in the challenge period, formatted as a string.

Argument.name: challengeId
Argument.Description: The database id of the WorkItem representing the challenge.

Argument.name: certificationItem
Argument.Description: The CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem for the challenge

EmailTemplate.Subject: Access being removed or limited for '$challengeItem'

EmailTemplate.name: Account Group Challenge Creation Notification
EmailTemplate.Body:
It has been determined that permissions on account group '$entityName' will be limited or removed completely. You have $timeRemaining to challenge this decision.
Click on this link to challenge the decision: http://localhost:8080/identityiq/user/challenge.jsf?id=$challengeId
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying a challenger that they can challenge a certification decision.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object containing the item being challenged.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the certification.

Argument.name: entityName
Argument.Description: The name of the item being challenged.

Argument.name: challengeItem
Argument.Description: A short description of the item being challenged.

Argument.name: timeRemaining
Argument.Description: The time remaining in the challenge period, formatted as a string.

Argument.name: challengeId
Argument.Description: The database id of the WorkItem representing the challenge.

Argument.name: certificationItem
Argument.Description: The CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem for the challenge

EmailTemplate.Subject: Access being removed or limited for '$entityName'

EmailTemplate.name: Certification Decision Challenged Notification
EmailTemplate.Body:
$challengerName has challenged the decision for '$challengeItem' in $certificationName.
Comments from $challengerName: -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $!challengeComments --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Please login to IdentityIQ to accept or reject this challenge.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying a certifier that a decision has been challenged.

Argument.name: challengeItem
Argument.Description: The shortDescription property of the CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the Certification object containing the item being challenged.

Argument.name: challengerName
Argument.Description: The full name (first and last) of the Identity that made the challenge.

Argument.name: challengeComments
Argument.Description: Comments from the challenger.

Argument.name: certificationItem
Argument.Description: The CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem for the challenge

EmailTemplate.Subject: Certification decision for '$challengeItem' challenged

EmailTemplate.name: Challenge Accepted
EmailTemplate.Body:
$certifierName has accepted the challenge for '$challengeItem' and will change the decision.
Comments from $certifierName: -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $!decisionComments --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying a challenger that their challenge was accepted.

Argument.name: challengeItem
Argument.Description: The shortDescription property of the CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: decisionComments
Argument.Description: Comments to the challenger.

Argument.name: certifierName
Argument.Description: The full name (first and last) of the Identity that accepted the challenge.

Argument.name: certificationItem
Argument.Description: The CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem for the challenge

EmailTemplate.Subject: Challenge accepted for '$challengeItem'

EmailTemplate.name: Challenge Rejected
EmailTemplate.Body:
$certifierName has rejected the challenge for '$challengeItem'. The decision will remain.
Comments from $certifierName: -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- $!rejectionComments --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying a challenger that their challenge was rejected.

Argument.name: challengeItem
Argument.Description: The shortDescription property of the CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: rejectionComments
Argument.Description: Comments to the challenger.

Argument.name: certifierName
Argument.Description: The full name (first and last) of the Identity that rejected the challenge.

Argument.name: certificationItem
Argument.Description: The CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem for the challenge

EmailTemplate.Subject: Challenge rejected for '$challengeItem'

EmailTemplate.name: Challenge Expiration
EmailTemplate.Body: The challenge period for '$challengeItem' has expired. This certification decision can no longer be contested.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying a challenger that they can no longer challenge a certification decision.

Argument.name: challengeItem
Argument.Description: The short description of the CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the certification containing the item being challenged.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object.

Argument.name: certificationItem
Argument.Description: The CertificationItem being challenged.

EmailTemplate.Subject: Challenge expired for '$challengeItem'

EmailTemplate.name: Challenge Decision Expiration
EmailTemplate.Body: The challenge period for the challenged item '$challengeItem' has expired without the certifier accepting or rejecting the challenge. The original decision will stay.
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying a challenger and certifier that an item that was challenged was not acted upon (accepted or rejected) by the time the challenge period expired, so the decision will stay.

Argument.name: challengeItem
Argument.Description: The short description of the CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: certificationName
Argument.Description: The name of the certification containing the item being challenged.

Argument.name: certification
Argument.Description: The Certification object.

Argument.name: certificationItem
Argument.Description: The CertificationItem being challenged.

Argument.name: workItem
Argument.Description: The WorkItem for the challenge

EmailTemplate.Subject: Challenge decision expired for '$challengeItem'

EmailTemplate.name: Open Certifications
EmailTemplate.Body:
Dear $certifier,
You have $certification_count certification(s) outstanding. Please login to IdentityIQ to complete your certifications.
Sincerely, The Recertification Admin Team
EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying a manager/app owner that they have open certifications outstanding. This is an "instant" email sent on demand from the certification dashboard components. See EmailBean and Emailer.compileOpenCertEmail for context.

Argument.name: certificationCount

EmailTemplate.Subject: $certification_count Certification(s) Outstanding

EmailTemplate.Body: Please find the requested report file(s) attached to this email.

EmailTemplate.Body:

Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that is the target of the provisioning.

EmailTemplate.Description: Email Template for notifying the manager when account creation is completed

Argument.name: workflow
Argument.Description: The Workflow object being executed.

Argument.name: approvalSet
Argument.Description: The ApprovalSet object contained in the workflow.

Argument.name: refIdentityDisplayName
Argument.Description: The name of the Identity that is registering.

Argument.name: recipientDisplayName
Argument.Description: The display name of the Identity that is registering.

Argument.name: provisioningErrors
Argument.Description: Any provisioning errors that may have occurred.

Argument.name: disableStaticManagerContent
Argument.Description: if false, then do not hide static content
